WELCOME: Welcome to your PANEDA headend system
SUBCHANNEL_ID_NOT_ALLOWED: Subchannel ID {{usedSubchannelId}} is not allowed according to contract.
SERVICE_ID_NOT_ALLOWED: Service ID {{usedServiceId}} is not allowed according to contract.
ENTER_VALID_EMAIL: Please enter a valid email address
INVALID_CREDENTIALS: Invalid username and/or password. Try again.
ACTIVATE_CONFIG_ASAP: Activate configuration as soon as possible
CONFIG_SYNTAX_ERROR: Invalid configuration syntax. Try fixing the problem in the expert editor.
CAPACITY_OVERBOOKED: Capacity overbooked. Used: {{usedCu}} CU. Allowed capacity: {{cuCapacity}} CU.
NO_CONFIG_SELECTED: No configuration selected. Please select or create a configuration to edit.
H_LONG_SERVICE_LABEL: The service label, or programme service label, consists of a maximum of 16 characters. It is transmitted in fig 1/1
H_SHORT_SERVICE_LABEL: The short service label consist of 8 selectable characters from the long label and is used by devices with a limited sceen size. Toggle the selection of a character by clicking the corresponding button.
H_SUBCHANNEL_ID: The identifier of the channel in the ensemble that carries the data for this service.
H_BITRATE: The bitrate for this service before any EEP/UEP error correction is applied.
H_SBR: Spectral band replication. Improves percieved sound quality for low to medium bitrates.
H_AUDIO_MODE_AAC: Requested audio mode. Parametric stereo improves percieved sound quality for low bitrates. Requires SBR.
H_AUDIO_MODE_MP2: Requested audio mode. Joint stereo improves percieved sound quality for low bitrates.
H_EEP_LEVEL: Level 1-4A can be used with all bitrates. level 1-4B only with multiples of 32kbit/s. The net bitrate after error protection is applied is shown to the right. Not sure? Pick 3A!
H_PAD_RATE: The bitrate of the programme associative data (PAD). Remember the effective audio bitrate is decreased with the PAD allocation. 0 = disable PAD
H_AAC_SAMPLE_FREQ: The output sampling frequency of the encoder. Note. if SRB is enabled the core sampling frequency is 16 or 24 kHz instead of 32 or 48 kHz.
H_MP2_SAMPLE_FREQ: The sampling frequency of the encoder. 24 or 48 kHz.
H_AUTO_GEN_FIG013: If slideshow is included in PAD fig 0/13 must indicate this in order to enable the receivers to decode the images. Tick the switch to get an auto generated fig 0/13.
H_LANGUAGE: The language of the program. Set to Unknown if not specified. Available languages according to ETSI TS 101 756 V1.6.1.
H_PTY: The content type of the program. Set to no programme type if not specified. Available programme types according to ETSI TS 101 756 V1.6.1.
H_GEN_STATIC_PTY: Program type can either be static, dynamic or both. A static program type should indicate the overall content for the service, for example pop music. Dynamic PTYs can be used to update this as the content changes over a day. For example during the news.
H_AUDIO_SOURCE: The source of the audio. One source can be used in several services if desired.
H_PAD_SOURCE: The source of the PAD data. One source can be used in several services if desired.
PASSWORD_LENGTH: The password must be between 6-100 characters.
FAILED_UPDATE_VIRTUAL_PROVIDER_FOR: Failed to update virtual provider for
SHOULD_SEND_SEPARATELY: Should be sent separately if the system is accessible from the internet
SCAN_THE_BARCODE: Scan the QR code with your two factor authentication app
ENTER_ONE_TIME_TOKEN: Enter the code from your two factor authentication app
TWO_FACTOR_DISABLE_FAILED: Unable to disable two factor authentication
H_IN_SUBCHANNEL_ID: The subchannel ID in the ETI stream to extract.
H_LINKED_SUBCHANNEL_ID: The subchannel ID you want to link this service too. The subchannel must exist in the configuration.
H_ETI_SOURCE: The source representing the ETI stream you want to extract a subchannel from. In addition a static converter from for example EDI is needed.
NO_CLUSTER_CONFIGURED: No cluster configured. Contact Paneda to set up redundancy!
TITLE: Title
MUST_BE_GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Must be greater than or equal to
MUST_BE_LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Must be less than or equal to
NAME: Name
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ALL: Includes every alarm source in the system.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_AUDIO_ENCODER: Indicates that the audio encoder is producing data (aac/mp2).
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_AUDIO_INPUT: Indicates that the audio input is producing raw audio samples.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_AUDIO_SILENCE: Indicates that the audio is not silent.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_INPUT_BUFFER: Indicates that the multiplexer receives data for the subchannel.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ENCODER_LAUNCER: Indicates that the enocder launcer in the encoder pool is working.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PAD: Indicates that PAD data is produced for the service.
H_CPU_LOAD: Indicated the CPU load of the unit.
H_OS_FREE_MEM: Indicates if enough RAM memory is available.
H_PANEDA_APP_FREE_MEM: Indicates if the memory allocation in Paneda applications is OK.
H_NTP_SYNC: Indicates if the system clock is synchronized via NTP.
H_LAST_ACTIVATED_CONFIG: Indicates if the last activated configuration was OK.
H_SCHEDULER_RUNNING: Indicates that the scheduler is monitoring the schedule.
H_API_TOKEN_NEVER_SHOWN_AGAIN: Copy your token now. It will never be shown again.
H_API_TOKEN_USAGE: Use your token in the Authorization header with type Bearer.
SELECT_AUTO_TO_ADJUST_TIMEZONE: Select auto as local time offset in ensemble configuration to select your time zone.
DRAG_DROP_OR_PASTE_IMAGES_HERE: Drag and drop or paste images here to upload
DRAG_AND_DROP_IMAGES_NOT_SUPPORTED: Drag and drop images not supported. Please use a modern browser
PAD_SOURCE_NOT_EDITABLE: The selected PAD source cannot be edited
H_VOLUME: Output volume in percent of input. 100% = no change. Use with great care as clipping may occur.
H_SIGNAL_ANNOUNCEMENT_SUPPORT: Check this box to signal announcement support for the service. (Fig 0/18)
H_ANNOUNCEMENT_CLUSTER: The announcement cluster(s) or group(s) that can interrupt this service
H_ANNOUNCEMENT_TYPE: The type(s) of announcements that can interrupt this service. The alarm type is always activated.
NEW_VERSION_RELOAD_NEEDED: A new GUI version has been installed. Please reload the browser to use it.
SYSTEM_IS_PASSIVE: System is passive. Action requires an active system
H_SILENCE_DETECT_TIME_SPAN: The minimum time the audio level must be below the threshold in order to trigger the silece alarm.
H_SILENCE_DETECT_THRESHOLD: The maximum level allowed of the incoming audio in order to trigger the silence alarm.
H_COMPENSATE_FOR_DRIFT: If the input audio is not syncronized to the correct clock, periodic glitches will occur. When checked, the drift is compensated for using a high quality resampler. This ensures a continuous stream without glitches.
NO_AUDIO_SERVICES_FOUND_IN_CONFIGURATION: No audio services found in configuration
NO_DATA_SERVICES_FOUND_IN_CONFIGURATION: No data services found in configuration
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_DATA_INPUT: Indicates that raw data is received at the input source.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_DATA_GROUP_ENCODER: Indicates that the data group encoder is producing data groups.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_PMD_SUBCHANNEL_ENCODER: Indicates that the packet mode encoder is producing data for the subchannel
H_DATA_SOURCE: The source of the data. One source can be used in several services if desired.
H_DATA_TYPE: The type of data sent. See Data Service Component Type (DSCTy) in ETSI TS 101 756 (Registered Tables)
H_USER_APPLICATION: The user application type of the data. See User Application type (UAtype) in ETSI TS 101 756 (Registered Tables)
H_PACKET_ADDRESS: The address of the packets carrying the data in the subchannel.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_ETI_INPUT: Indicates that valid ETI data is received.
H_STATUS_CHANNELS_SUBCHANNEL_DATA: Indicates that the selected subchannel is found in the ETI data.
FW_IS_ACTIVE: The firewall is active and filtering traffic.
FW_IS_INACTIVE: Warning: The firewall is inactive. All traffic is allowed.
FIREWALL_RULE_DELETED: Firewall rule deleted. Remember to commit the change.
FIREWALL_ENABLED: Firewall enabled. Remember to commit the change.
H_COMMIT_FIREWALL_SETTINGS: The firewall has been activated / more restricted. Please verify access and then commit the changes.
H_AUTOMATIC_DEACTIVATION: The firewall will automatically deactivate in {{timeLeft}} seconds to prevent you from locking yourself out.
BITRATE_MULTIPLE_32: Bitrate must be a multiple of 32 when EEP level B is used
USE_SWITCH_PATCHING: If possible. Patch output from all available inputs
USE_SF_SWITCHING: If possible. Do the switchover on a superframe boundary
PREFER_ASC: Prefer mux by name, in ascending order
PREFER_DESC: Prefer mux by name, in descending order
NO_SWITCH_INSTALLED: No switch installed. Contact Paneda to set up redundancy!
H_UPSTREAM_CONNECTION: Indicates that the network connection to the upstream is working.
H_ETI_INPUT_DATA_COARSE_QUALITY: Indicates that the incoming ETI data is syntactically ok.
H_OUTPUT_ENDPOINT: Indicates that the sending of data to the endoint is successful.
H_ETI_INPUT_DATA_FINE_QUALITY: Indicates that the incoming ETI stream, including all subchannels, contains OK data.
H_SWITCH_OUTPUT: Indicates that the output from the switch, including all subchannels, contains OK data.
H_EQUIVALENT_DATA_FOUND: Indicates that two or more streams carrying equivalent data is found. This enables seamless switchover.
H_PREFERRED_SELECTED: Indicates that the preferred input is used as output without modifications.
H_DEVICE_CONNECTION: Indicates that the device is connected to the server.
UNSUPPORTED_BROWSER: Your browser is not supported. Use Google Chrome for the best user experience.
PETI_FEC_HELP_2: When level B us used, columns must be at least 4
NO_PETI_INSTALLED: No FEP output installed. Contact Paneda to install module.
NO_EDI_INSTALLED: No EDI output installed. Contact Paneda to install module.
CU_OVERALLOCATED: Capacity overallocated. Remove {{cu}} CU from contract
ADD_ITEM_S: Add item(s). Press enter to add.
PROGRAM_SERVICE_REF_DUPLICATES: The following programme service references are duplicated: {{dupes}}
DATA_SERVICE_REF_DUPLICATES: The following data service references are duplicated: {{dupes}}
COUNTRY_ID_MISMATCH_IN_ENSEMBLE_ID: The ensemble ID has inconsistent country ID. Found: {{foundId}}. Expected: {{expectedId}}.
H_LONG_LABEL: The label consists of a maximum of 16 bytes.
H_SHORT_LABEL: The short label consists of a subset of the long label. Maximum 8 characters.
INVALID_COUNTRY_CODES: The combination of country code, ecc and itu code seem invalid.
LABEL_TOO_LONG: The label "{{label}}" requires {{bytes}} bytes to be encoded in {{encoding}}. 16 bytes are max.
H_RECONFIGURATION_NEEDED: The current configuration on air may not reflect the latest changes that has been performed
TWO_FACTOR_MUST_BE_ENABLED_FOR_THIS_FEAT: Two factor authentication must be enabled to use this feature
FORM_INVALID: The form is invalid. Please fill out all fields according to the instructions.
USER_NOT_AUTH_FOR_PROXY: Your user is not authorized to use the selected proxy connection
CLOSE_MY_SESSIONS: Close my sessions (You have {{numActiveSessions}} active session(s) )
CLOSE_ALL_SESSIONS: Close all sessions (Other users have {{numActiveSessions}} active session(s) )
PBS_WELCOME: Welcome to your PANEDA break-in system
H_PBS_STATUS_RF_INPUT: Indicates the presence of external DAB signal
H_PBS_STATUS_TF_ALIGNMENT: Indicates that the external and local transmission frames are aligned
H_PBS_STATUS_CLOCK_SYNC: Indicates that the external and local time domain are synchronized
H_PBS_STATUS_SIGNAL_CTRL: Indicates the presence of a break-in state signal
H_PBS_STATUS_DRNS: Indicates the prescense of the hardware RF-switch
SUCCESS_UPDATE_PVP_VOLUME: Successfully updated PVP volume. The hardware adjusted the value to: {{volume}} %
FAILED_UPDATE_PVP_VOLUME: Failed to update the PVP volume
SUCCESS_TURNED_ON_ID_LED: Successfully turned on the ID LED
SUCCESS_TURNED_OFF_ID_LED: Successfully turned off the ID LED
FAILED_TO_CHANGE_THE_ID_LED: Failed to change the state of the ID_LED
